articles.title: DPRK Officials Visit China's Flotilla
articles.content:
DPRK Officials Visit China's Flotilla
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Senior officers of the Korean People's Army and leading officials of local party and power bodies Saturday visited the flotilla of the Navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army. 
					
					Among the visitors were Vice-Minister of the People's Armed Forces Pak Jae Gyong, KPA Admiral Jong Myong Do who is commander of the KPA Navy, KPA Rear Admiral Kim Myong Sik, Chief Secretary of the Wonsan City Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Yom Pong Jin and Chairman of the Wonsan City People's Committee Ri Il Sop. 
					
					A welcome function took place on the ships. 
					
					The visitors looked round equipment and facilities of frigate "Luoyang," being briefed on it by its captain.

articles.title: Meeting of Seamen of DPRK and China Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Seamen of DPRK and China Held
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting of seamen of the Korean People's Army and the Chinese People's Liberation Army took place on China's training ship "Zheng He" on Friday.
					
					The KPA seamen looked round equipment and facilities of the ship and frigate "Luoyang", conducted by leading officers of the flotilla of the CPLA Navy.
					
					At the meeting speakers said the armies of the two countries are contributing to protecting the regional peace and stability while supporting and cooperating with each other in the struggle for socialism against imperialism.
					
					They expressed the will to contribute to boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the armies of the two countries, the navies in particular.
					
					An art performance was given by soldiers of the two countries.
					
					The seamen of the two countries talked to each other with joy at their meeting, deepening friendship.

articles.title: Chinese Seamen Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Chinese Seamen Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Leading officers of the visiting flotilla of the Navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army headed by Vice Admiral Tian Zhong, commander of the North Sea Fleet of the Navy, visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Saturday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The guests made deep bows in boundless reverence to the President who made undying contributions to the development of the DPRK-China friendship and the cause of global independence.
					
					The commander wrote in the visitor's book that "All generations praise his great life."

articles.title: Chinese Seamen Enjoy Performance by Song and Dance Ensemble of KPA Navy
articles.content:
Chinese Seamen Enjoy Performance by Song and Dance Ensemble of KPA Navy
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Seamen of the flotilla of the Navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army enjoyed a performance given by the Song and Dance Ensemble of the Navy of the Korean People's Army at Kalma Theatre on Saturday. 
					
					Among the audience were leading officers and other seamen of the flotilla headed by Vice Admiral Tian Zhong, commander of the North Sea Fleet of the CPLA Navy, and the military attache of the Chinese embassy here. 
					
					KPA Admiral Jong Myong Do, commander of the KPA Navy, Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, KPA Rear Admiral Kim Myong Sik and general officers and officers, Yom Pong Jin, chief secretary of the Wonsan City Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Il Sop, chairman of the Wonsan City People's Committee, enjoyed the performance together with the guests. 
					
					Put on the stage were mixed choruses "Hoist Flag of Supreme Commander" and "My Ship Is Dear Homeland", tap dance "Morning in Sailing" and dance "Death-defying Corps on Sea" and other numbers.
					
					In their performance they enthusiastically sang of the militant stamina of the seamen of the KPA which has grown to be an invincible army under Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il. 
					
					The performers also presented Chinese songs to please the guests. 
					
					The performance was acclaimed by the audience.

articles.title: Greetings to PM of Jamaica
articles.content:
Greetings to PM of Jamaica
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Saturday sent a message of greetings to Bruce Golding, prime minister of Jamaica, on the 49th anniversary of its independence.
					
					Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger thanks to their concerted efforts, the message wished him success in his work for the country's prosperity and people's well-being.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Alassane Ouattara, president of Cote d'Ivoire, on Thursday on its 51st independence day. 
					
					Kim in the message wished the president of Cote d'Ivoire big success in the work for stability, peace and development of the country, hoping that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Congratulations to FM of Vietnam
articles.content:
Congratulations to FM of Vietnam
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Pham Binh Minh          upon his appointment as foreign minister at the first session of the 13th People's Assembly of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.
					
					Pak in the message wished Pham Binh Minh success in his new job, expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger on the road of carrying out the common cause of socialism.

articles.title: 50th Anniversary of Construction Economy and Standard Institute Marked
articles.content:
50th Anniversary of Construction Economy and Standard Institute Marked
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Construction Economy and Standard Institute marked its golden jubilee.
					
					Established on August 7, Juche 50 (1961), the institute was splendidly built and achieved great successes in its research work under the care of the peerless great men. 
					
					President Kim Il Sung laid down policies for capital construction and ways for their implementation in every period of the revolutionary development and at each stage, wisely leading the work to make sure that vast construction was successfully carried out on a scientific and technical basis. 
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il published the work "On Bringing about a Fresh Turn in Capital Construction" on August 11, 2004 clearly indicating the way to be followed by capital construction in the Songun era.
					
					A meeting was held to mark the anniversary on Saturday. 
					
					It was attended by officials concerned and the officials and employees of the institute.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Assails S. Korean Authorities' Fabrication of "Spy Ring Case"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Assails S. Korean Authorities' Fabrication of "Spy Ring Case"
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are trying to implicate the DPRK in the "spy ring case", the largest-ever cooked up after the emergence of the present "government."
					
					The Intelligence Service and police of south Korea kicked off an unprecedented repressive campaign, charging that progressive forces and those related to the reunification movement including the chief editor of magazine Minjok 21 and the representative of Chongchun, an Internet broadcasting service under the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration, conducted "espionage" at the "instruction of the north".
					
					This serious provocation revealed the fin de siecle symptom of the fascist group obsessed by confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					The south Korean authorities are now finding themselves in a tight corner for the acts of treachery committed since they came to power. They seek to find a way-out of it in orchestrating a shocking "case."
					
					The successive south Korean rulers have been engrossed in provoking the DPRK. Whenever they found themselves in crises, they cooked up anti-DPRK cases and used them for stoking hostility toward the fellow countrymen in the DPRK while escalating confrontation and war moves. This was their trite artifice.
					
					This year the south Korean Court declared non-guilty Mr. Jo Pong Am, former leader of the Progressive Party, who was executed on the charge of his alleged involvement in "a spy ring case" 52 years ago. This was just part of tragedies showing the preposterous nature of "spy ring cases" and the like fabricated by the south Korean authorities.
					
					At a time when the expectation for dialogue between the north and the south is running high, the south Korean puppet group is employing a hackneyed method, defying the requirement of the reality. This only brings into bolder relief their wretched plight of being mired by the worst ruling crisis.
					
					The recent case brought to light the true colors of the puppet conservative group who stakes its fate on escalated confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					It is quite natural that the south Koreans are denouncing the harsh suppression of the progressive forces and those related to the reunification movement as "hunting" of the ordinary people desirous of national reunification by dint of "the National Security Law."

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Independence, Equality and Mutual Benefit
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Independence, Equality and Mutual Benefit
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- It is an important factor of promoting the development of international relations to respect each other's sovereignty and boost exchange and cooperation on the principle of equality.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					It goes on:
					
					The principles of independence, equality and mutual benefit are inseparable from the international relations.
					
					It is a fundamental principle governing the sound development of international relations for countries to respect each other's sovereignty. 
					
					Without respect for each other's sovereignty it is impossible to have true cooperation and exchange among countries nor is it possible to establish strong international relations. 
					
					Adherence to the principle of equality serves as an important principle to govern the external activities of every country and a main requirement for the healthy development of international relations.
					
					All countries and nations are equal as members of the international community.
					
					If countries are to establish true and durable international relations of cooperation and exchange, they should help each other and protect each other's interests. 
					
					They cannot but closely combine the efforts for the development of international relations based on the principles of independence, equality and mutual benefit with the struggle against the imperialists as they still remain on the earth and are persisting in their moves for aggression, war and interference to realize their ambition for world domination. 
					
					Cooperation and exchange among countries based on the said principles have become brisk in recent years as a result of the appearance of regional organizations and unions of different types. 
					
					The DPRK has exerted efforts for the development of international relations based on those principles, the article concludes.

articles.title: Corruptions of S. Korean Bureaucrats Disclosed
articles.content:
Corruptions of S. Korean Bureaucrats Disclosed
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Scandals of officials of the Ministry of Knowledge and Economy of south Korea have been brought to light, sparking off furor, south Korean MBC reported on August 3.
					
					More than 10 officials including persons of section chief level have reportedly got frequent drinking service from affiliated organs so far from 2010.
					
					Cases of irregularities and corruption by the ruling quarters are now being reported one after another in south Korea.

articles.title: Grave Situation in Tok Islets Attributable to Humiliating Diplomacy
articles.content:
Grave Situation in Tok Islets Attributable to Humiliating Diplomacy
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are becoming evermore undisguised in their moves to grab Tok Islets. 
					
					They kicked off a "protest" campaign against the test flight over Tok Islets by a south Korean airliner and disallowed Japanese government employees to use south Korean planes. 
					
					On Monday, Dietmen from the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan went to the Kimpho Airport for tour of Ullung Island only to be expelled. Later the Japanese foreign minister called the south Korean ambassador to Japan to express "regret." As a threatening gesture, he blustered this would be raised as a diplomatic issue.
					
					On the same day an exhibition took place in downtown Tokyo to assert Tok Islets belong to Japan's territory.
					
					These reckless actions of the Japanese reactionaries are attributable to the humiliating behavior of the present south Korean conservative ruling quarters. They have pursued a sycophantic and humiliating policy, talking about "calm diplomacy" over the issue of relations with Japan. 
					
					Whenever such voices critical of the government as the "government got slapped in its cheek by Japan for submitting to it" and "no more calm response" are heard from among south Koreans from all walks of life, the puppet authorities did not hesitate to talk such nonsense as south Korea has "mature partnership" with Japan and "it is not a reasonable response to strongly react to Japan, swayed by temporary upsetting."
					
					When there cropped up the issue of building Tok Islets comprehensive marine science base in the waters off the islets in March, the authorities tried to delete "Tok Islets" from the name of the base, reading the face of their Japanese master. They came under strong fire for their behavior after the disclosure of the fact. 
					
					Some time ago, the puppet authorities submitted to an international body an absurd proposal calling for the simultaneous use of the East Sea of Korea and "Japan Sea," sparking public uproar. 
					
					The situation in Tok Islets has reached such serious pass due to the south Korean authorities' humiliating and sycophantic "calm diplomacy".

articles.title: Three Charters for Korea's Reunification Supported by Benin Personage
articles.content:
Three Charters for Korea's Reunification Supported by Benin Personage
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Hessou Kohovi, chairman of Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and of General Kim Jong Il's Work issued a statement on August 1 to mark the 14th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification."
					
					It said the three charters for national reunification formulated by Kim Jong Il are indicating the way to be followed by the Korean people in their struggle for national reunification as they have great vitality. 
					
					It is the most realistic way for reunification to establish a federal-style unified state of the nation based on the theory of one nation, one state, two systems and two governments. The reunification of Korea can come true only when an atmosphere of confrontation between the north and south is removed and an environment of peace and reconciliation is created, it noted.
					
					It urged the south Korean authorities to stop such belligerent actions as recklessly hurting the dignity of the leadership and the inviolable system of the DPRK and perpetrating military provocations against it in collusion with the U.S.
					
					It extended firm support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to implement the three charters for national reunification--the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point program of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.

articles.title: Korean People's Victory in War Observed by Russian Paper
articles.content:
Korean People's Victory in War Observed by Russian Paper
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Patriot No. 28 carried special articles headlined "Decisive factor of victory" and "Armistice Agreement" on the day of the victory of the Korean people in the war." They were illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					The shining victory won by the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War was entirely thanks to the wise leadership of the President, the paper said, and went on:
					
					July 27, 1953 when the Korean Armistice Agreement was signed was the day of weighty significance in the modern history.
					
					More than half a century has passed since the ceasefire but the U.S. has been persistent in its political and military provocations and economic sanctions against the DPRK. The Korean people have, however, defended socialism, resolutely foiling the moves of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					A durable peace has not yet been settled in the Korean Peninsula because the U.S. is opposed to the conclusion of a peace treaty.
					
					No force on earth can bring the Korean people to their knees as long as there are the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, the Juche idea and the Songun politics.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats for Liberation of Country Praised by Mexican Paper
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats for Liberation of Country Praised by Mexican Paper
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional July 31 carried a special write-up on a whole page under the title of "With Superb Guerilla Strategy" with a photo of President Kim Il Sung commanding the Pochonbo Battle. It was carried on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					It said on August 15, 1945 the Korean people were liberated from the military occupation of the Japanese imperialists, adding the liberation of Korea was the victory of the President's superb guerilla war methods.
					
					The outstanding strategy of the President was clearly proved by the Pochonbo Battle fought in June 1937, it noted, stressing it ended in the victory of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army in a brief span of time under his wise command.
					
					The battle was of great significance as it imbued the Korean people with the confidence that Korea was not dead but alive and they were sure to achieve the national independence and liberation if they fought, it said, and continued:
					
					The President won victory after victory in many battles fought by dint of superb and rare war methods during the anti-Japanese war. Finally he crushed Japanese imperialism and achieved the historic cause of Korea's liberation. 
					
					The feats performed by him in liberating Korea will always go down in the world history of national liberation struggle in colonies.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Indian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Indian Paper
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Indian paper Public News on August 1 carried an article headlined "May United Front Tower Stand Forever" on the 14th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification". 
					
					The tower, which was erected at the place where President Kim Il Sung spent a significant day while having a consultative meeting with south Korean politicians who participated in the North-South Joint Conference, a nationwide meeting to check the permanent division of Korea on May 2, 1948, always conveys the history of great national unity, the paper said, and went on:
					
					The consultative meeting on Ssuk Islet held that day was a significant meeting which taught the truth that there can be factions and isms only when there are the country and nation. It was, at the same time, a historic meeting which demonstrated that if personages sit at the same place in the idea of patriotism irrespective of political view and religious belief and have an open-hearted discussion, they can form a united front and contribute to the cause of reunification.
					
					Completely attracted by the transparent patriotic idea, outstanding stratagem, broad magnanimity and noble personality of the President, south Korean politicians praised him as the supreme leader of the nation and entirely entrusted the destiny of the nation and their own to him. Afterwards, they dedicated their lives to the cause of alliance with communism and national reunification.
					
					The feats the President performed for achieving the unity of the Korean nation and the reunification of Korea will always remain shining along with the United Front Tower.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by Nepali Personage
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by Nepali Personage
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Gagan Bista, chairman of the Nepali paper Chautari, contributed his travelogue on the DPRK under the title of "Socialist Policies of the DPRK" to the August issue of the organ of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist.)
					
					He wrote in his travelogue that the DPRK is achieving prosperity by dint of socialist political mode and policies, frustrating the sanctions of the imperialists. He went on:
					
					President Kim Il Sung who achieved the independence of the country was the first to enforce socialist policies in the DPRK.
					
					The U.S. and other hostile forces are escalating the military threat and economic sanctions against the DPRK while intensifying the smear and false propaganda against the DPRK to bring it down. 
					
					The people of the DPRK are, however, united as firm as a rock.
					
					But for foreign interference and threat, the DPRK would have become a powerful and rich country.
					
					The people of the DPRK are working hard for the prosperity and development of the country and achieving great successes under the banner of the Juche idea.
					
					The DPRK is more powerful than what we have known.

articles.title: China Cooperates with Pakistan in Anti-terrorism Battle
articles.content:
China Cooperates with Pakistan in Anti-terrorism Battle
						

					Beijing, August 5 (KCNA) -- China Wednesday vowed to strengthen cooperation with Pakistan in the anti-terrorism battle.
					
					Speaking to reporters, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Ma Zhaoxu said the two countries are friendly neighbors.
					
					China will continue anti-terrorism cooperation with Pakistan and defend security and stability in the two countries and in the region, he said.

articles.title: Strict Supervision over Reservoirs Urged in China
articles.content:
Strict Supervision over Reservoirs Urged in China
						

					Beijing, August 5 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Ministry of Environmental Protection recently issued a notice concerning supervision and control over headwater environment in the rainy season.
					
					The notice called on relevant organs to strictly carry on examination of water quality and survey of environment of headwaters, so as to eliminate the factors of water pollution in time and prevent accidents.

articles.title: Putin Calls for Unity of Society
articles.content:
Putin Calls for Unity of Society
						

					Moscow, August 5 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin, addressing a meeting with participants in a youth forum on August 1, said Russia needs the unity of society.
					
					He said it is very important for Russia to unite people with different views of politics and different versions of the future. 
					
					The unity should be based on patriotism, he stressed.

articles.title: Nepal Opposes Anti-China Actions
articles.content:
Nepal Opposes Anti-China Actions
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Nepali Prime Minister Jhalanath Khanal in a seminar on Nepal-China relations on August 1 expressed his government's will not to allow anti-China activities in the country.
					
					Nepal is opposed to any forces engaging in anti-China activities in the country, he said.
					
					Nepal and China, over the past 56 years after the establishment of diplomatic relations, have developed friendship and cooperation on the basis of the five principles of peaceful co-existence and consistently supported and cooperated with each other, he said. Nepal will invariably maintain the one-China policy.

articles.title: Indian PM Calls for Unity of Political Parties
articles.content:
Indian PM Calls for Unity of Political Parties
						

					New Delhi, August 5 (KCNA) -- Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh Monday appealed to opposition parties to come together and tackle problems facing the country.
					
					"It is our sincere desire that this session should run smoothly and Parliament should discuss all issues of national importance and the government is quite prepared for any subject which the Opposition would like to be taken up," he said before addressing the parliament.
					
					He also called on all political parties to unite with each other.

articles.title: Pakistan Restricts U.S. Diplomats' Travel
articles.content:
Pakistan Restricts U.S. Diplomats' Travel
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Pakistani government recently took a measure to impose restrictions on Pakistan-resident U.S. diplomats' travel.  
					
					The measure requires the U.S. diplomats, if they want to go out of Islamabad, to apply to the Pakistani government for a special permission five days earlier.

articles.title: Russia, China to Stage Joint Naval Exercises
articles.content:
Russia, China to Stage Joint Naval Exercises
						

					Moscow, August 5 (KCNA) -- Russia and China Thursday agreed to stage joint naval exercises.
					
					The agreement came at talks held in Moscow between Nikolai Makarov, chief of the General Staff of Russian Federal Armed Forces, and Chen Bingde, chief of the General Staff of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.
					
					The two sides also agreed to continue reciprocal cooperation in fields of national defense and military technology.

articles.title: Hunchun-Zaruvino Transport Routes Opened
articles.content:
Hunchun-Zarubino Transport Routes Opened
						

					Beijing, August 5 (KCNA) -- China and Russia opened new transport routes linking Hunchun in Jilin Province, China, and Zarubino Port in the Maritime territory, Russia.
					
					Ceremonies for a trial operation of the railway and opening the land-marine transport routes took place in Hunchun and Zarubino Port respectively on August 3.
					
					The new transport routes will reportedly be conducive to developing economic cooperation and trade between the two countries.

articles.title: Russian PM Appeals Officials to Behave Themselves Well
articles.content:
Russian PM Appeals Officials to Behave Themselves Well
						

					Moscow, August 5 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin, at a  recent meeting with participants in a youth education forum, appealed to the country's officials to behave themselves well. 
					
					What is important for the officials is to provide conditions for the development of the whole country, including local autonomous organs, districts, towns and villages, he said. 
					
					For this purpose, the officials should have graceful manners and refrain from abusing their authority, he added.

articles.title: Venezuelan President Calls for Ending Dictatorship of Dollar
articles.content:
Venezuelan President Calls for Ending Dictatorship of Dollar
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez Frias on Wednesday expressed sympathy with Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin's remark that the U.S. lives on the world economy, said the Russian news agency ITAR-TASS.
					
					In an article posted on his website he said the strategic proposal for introducing sucre is of great value and called for putting an end to dictatorship of dollar.

articles.title: Japan's Poor State of Education Revealed
articles.content:
Japan's Poor State of Education Revealed
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Japan's poor state of education has been revealed, causing a serious public concern.  
					
					Some time ago, a youth organization of Japan made a survey of high school students properly pointing to the boundaries of the country.
					
					The results show that only 1.8 percent of about 400 respondents throughout the country gave a correct answer, said a new report.

articles.title: U.S. Drone Strike in NW Pakistan
articles.content:
U.S. Drone Strike in NW Pakistan
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces are carrying on air raids on Pakistan under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					
					At least four people were killed in a U.S. drone strike launched late Tuesday night in Pakistan's northwest tribal area of North Waziristan.

articles.title: Cocaine Seized in Lebanon
articles.content:
Cocaine Seized in Lebanon
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A unit from Lebanon's Drug Enforcement Bureau seized 53 kilograms of cocaine near Beirut.
					
					Four men were taken to a police station.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Tibet, China
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Tibet, China
						

					Beijing, August 5 (KCNA) -- A 5.1-magnitude earthquake hit Nagqu area of the Tibet Autonomous Region of China on August 2.
					
					The epicenter was Nima County.

articles.title: Flood Hits China
articles.content:
Flood Hits China
						

					Beijing, August 5 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains have hit Shaanxi Province, China from July 28, causing damage.
					
					According to the Agency of Civil Affairs of the Province on Tuesday, more than 5 080 inhabitants were evacuated and crops in 5 400 hectares of fields damaged. A total of victims numbered 117 000.
					
					Meanwhile, flood hit Yichang City, Hubei Province from July 31 to August 1, leaving 107 900 victims and lots of farmlands and dwelling houses destroyed.
					
					Emergency relief steps are being taken in the afflicted areas.

articles.title: High-level Radiation Detected in Japan
articles.content:
High-level Radiation Detected in Japan
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Radiation leakage at the crippled Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant in Japan is getting serious.
					
					Tokyo Electric Power Co. on Tuesday said radiation dosages of 5 sieverts per hour were detected indoors on the second floor of the No. 1 reactor at the plant. 
					
					The amount is the highest figure for indoors which has so far been measured within the buildings of reactors Nos. 1-4, a news report said.
					
					On July 28 the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare noted that radioactive cesium above the permissible limit was detected in a total 1 557 tons of soils which were settled when water was being filtered at the purifying grounds in Miyagi, Fukushima, Niigata, Tochigi and Gunma prefectures.

articles.title: Japan's Automakers Suffer Serious Losses
articles.content:
Japan's Automakers Suffer Serious Losses
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Japanese automakers are suffering losses due to economic depression.
					
					Toyoda Motor Co. Monday quoted survey data as saying that the group net profit for the April-June quarter dropped 99.4 percent from a year earlier.
					
					Honda Motor Co. said Monday its group net profit for the April-June quarter plunged 88.3 percent from a year earlier.
					
					Daihatsu Motor Co. said Monday its group net profit in the first quarter of fiscal 2011 plummeted 65.8 percent from a year earlier.

articles.title: Serious Scramble for Natural Resources in North Pole
articles.content:
Serious Scramble for Natural Resources in North Pole
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Scrambles are getting more serious over the North Pole abundant in resources.
					
					Those countries around the Arctic Ocean are busy gaining dominium over the continental shelf.
					
					With biggest interest in the North Pole, Russia has long made preparations to cope with all possible circumstances.
					
					It announced that "North Pole", a multi-purpose space system for constantly monitoring the areas of the North Pole, would be deployed in 2014, and declared the foundation of the "North Pole unit" consisting of two brigades.
					
					Denmark and Canada have resisted such movement of Russia, insisting that the seabed of the Arctic Ocean is geologically linked with their coasts.
					
					The defense minister of Canada announced a plan to stage large-scale military exercises in the pole in August, stating that they are aimed to strengthen its military presence in this region.
					
					Besides, countries which do not belong to the coast of the Arctic Ocean are watching for a chance to get benefits in the scrambles for natural resources.
					
					British Petroleum Co. agreed to open the strategic alliance for developing the North Pole with the Rosnefti Company of Russia.
					
					Meanwhile, Secretary of the U.S. State Department Hillary, at a ministerial meeting of the five states on the coast of the Arctic Ocean made up of the U.S., Russia, Canada, Demark and Norway, took an ambiguous attitude of accusing chairman country Canada. She regarded it as doubtful that other countries beside those with interests in the North Pole were not invited to the meeting.
					
					Foreign news reports said that lurking behind this stand of the U.S. is its ulterior intention to embroil more countries in the scramble for natural resource in the North Pole and thus complicate the situation and catch fish in troubled waters.

articles.title: Different Countries Strive to Prevent Natural Disasters
articles.content:
Different Countries Strive to Prevent Natural Disasters
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Different countries are striving to prevent natural disasters.
					
					Iran recently opened the first center for receiving data from satellite in an effort to transmit such animation data to all parts of the country and use them for prevention of natural disasters and agricultural development.
					
					The Brazilian government organized a special relief group made up of medical experts, soldiers and volunteers to rapidly cope with natural disasters.
					
					Thailand set up a disaster alarming center to intensify the work to forecast quake and tidal wave.
					
					In order to settle the shortage of water caused by drought, China and Vietnam are pushing forward the drive to smoothly supply drinking water to inhabitants in the countryside and remote areas till 2015.
					
					Angola is striving to supply drinking water to over 80 percent of the inhabitants in the countryside till 2012 while Ethiopia plans to build 21 200 water supply facilities.
					
					The Nepali government is rebuilding water purifying grounds and supply facilities in different areas of the country till 2017 and Mozambique directs efforts to building reservoirs.
					
					Pakistan, Zimbabwe, Indonesia and Mexico have conducted a tree planting campaign while combating such practices as destroying biological environment.
					
					Multilateral and regional cooperation has been strengthened worldwide to prevent natural disasters.
					
					African countries built the regional disaster prevention center in Kenya and member nations of the Economic Community of West African States set up a regional organization for preventing natural disasters.
					
					ASEAN countries, too, are boosting cooperation with each other to establish a rapid reaction system on natural disasters.

articles.title: Mutual Cooperation among Developing Countries
articles.content:
Mutual Cooperation among Developing Countries
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Mexico and Colombia signed an agreement on enhancing cooperation against the organized crime on Monday.
					
					On July 31 Algeria agreed to deliver 640 million cubic meters of natural gas every year to Morocco in accordance with the already sealed deal.

articles.title: Lebanese PM Urges UN to End Israeli Violations
articles.content:
Lebanese PM Urges UN to End Israeli Violations
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Lebanon's Prime Minister Najib Mikati expressed fear on Tuesday over the ongoing Israeli violations of Lebanese sovereignty.
					
					The army and people of Lebanon will defend its rights and protect its sovereignty with all the available means, he said.
					
					He called upon the international community to put pressure on the Israeli authorities to honestly implement the UN resolution concerned.

articles.title: Singapore Refutes Human Trafficking Report Released by U.S.
articles.content:
Singapore Refutes Human Trafficking Report Released by U.S.
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- An inter-agency taskforce of Singapore on trafficking in persons has released on Monday a detailed response of five pages to a recent U.S. report on human trafficking.
					
					Recently the U.S. State Department issued a report saying that Singapore does not yet meet the elementary international standards in human trafficking. The document branded it completely groundless.
					
					Human trafficking is rampant in the U.S., it said.
					
					The United States has a more serious TIP (trafficking in persons report) problem compared with Singapore, it added.

articles.title: Indonesia Lambastes U.S. Interference in Other States' Affairs
articles.content:
Indonesia Lambastes U.S. Interference in Other States' Affairs
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Speaker of the Indonesian People's Consultative Assembly in a diplomatic appearance Tuesday scathingly accused the U.S. of interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
					
					The U.S. is on the verge of economic collapse as a result of its interference in other countries' domestic affairs, he said.
					
					Today the West, the U.S. in particular, has become desperate because of the public uprisings in Mideast regional countries, he noted.

articles.title: PLO Exposes Israeli Vicious Attempt
articles.content:
PLO Exposes Israeli Vicious Attempt
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Yasser Abed Rabbo, general secretary of the PLO Executive Committee, exposed the vicious attempt of Israel on Monday.
					
					That day Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that he was prepared to accept a Palestinian state within pre-1967 borders.
					
					The general secretary branded Netanyahu's remarks as a crafty move to make the Palestinian National Authority cancel its plans to ask for a United Nations vote on an independent state of Palestine next month and to recognize Israel as the home of Jews.
					
					He strongly demanded the Israeli authorities end their occupation of the Palestinian territories and stop at once the construction of Jewish settlements.

articles.title: Russian President Congratulates Nuclear Submarine Designer
articles.content:
Russian President Congratulates Nuclear Submarine Designer
						

					Moscow, August 5 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev sent a message to Igor Spaski, congratulating him on his 85th birthday, said the Russian news agency ITAR-TASS.
					
					Spaski is a nuclear submarine designer. He is a socialist labor hero, winner of the Soviet and Russian State Prizes and member of the Russian Academy of Sciences.
					
					In the message, the President praised him for his great contribution to strengthening the Russian Navy's might and missile and nuclear power.

articles.title: International Peace Seminar Held in Hiroshima
articles.content:
International Peace Seminar Held in Hiroshima
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- An international peace seminar was held in Hiroshima, Japan on July 31 on the theme "Road to termination of nuclear weapons -- what is civic society asking now?"
					
					The seminar discussed methods of eliminating nuclear weapons with the accident of the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Station taken into account.
					
					It also called for making this year, which witnessed the accident, an important occasion for nuclear disarmament.

articles.title: Pakistani President Hails FM Talks with India
articles.content:
Pakistani President Hails FM Talks with India
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari on July 29 praised the positive results of the talks between foreign ministers of Pakistan and India.
					
					At a meeting with the Pakistani prime minister, he said Pakistan would continue the dialogue process with India to solve all problems existing between the two countries in a peaceful way as early as possible.

articles.title: U.S. Seeks Nuke Deployment in Japan in 1950s
articles.content:
U.S. Seeks Nuke Deployment in Japan in 1950s
						

					Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed by a document on Thursday that the U.S. mapped out a policy of deploying nuclear weapons in Japan after calming down the anti-nuclear feelings of the Japanese people in the 1950s.  
					
					The U.S. document suggested putting emphasis on a peaceful use of atomic energy only at that time, with no mention of deployment of nuclear weapons, in order to pull down the A-bomb victim's mental barrier standing in the way of the U.S. nuclear strategy.
					
					The document revealed that the U.S. sought the deployment of nuclear weapons in Japan through atomic cooperation which started in earnest in 1954.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de flotilla china
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de flotilla china
						

					Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibe presente que le dirigiera la flotilla de las fuerzas navales del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China (EPLCh) que realiza una visita de amistad a Corea.
					
					El vicealmirante Tian Zhong, comandante de la Flota del Mar Norte del EPLCh, quien preside la flotilla, lo entrego el dia 5 al vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Kim Yong Chun, vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.

articles.title: Kim Yong Chun se reune con miembros de flotilla china
articles.content:
Kim Yong Chun se reune con miembros de flotilla china
						

					Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ACNC) -- El vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Kim Yong Chun, vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, departio este viernes en un ambiente amistoso con los miembros de mando de la flotilla de las fuerzas navales del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China (EPLCh) dirigida por el vicealmirante Tian Zhong, comandante de la Flota del Mar Norte del EPLCh.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre varios lugares de economia nacional
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre varios lugares de economia nacional
						

					Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim averiguo el dia 4 sobre el terreno la labor del Complejo de Maquinaria de Rakwon y la Granja Cooperativa de Sin-am del distrito Ryongchon.
					
					Luego de recorrer varios lugares del complejo y la granja cooperativa, convoco reuniones de consulta con los funcionarios de sectores correspondientes.
					
					En las ocasiones se debatieron los asuntos de medida para producir gran cantidad de productos mecanicos de buena calidad dando acicate a modernizar y cientifizar los procesos de produccion y aumentar el rendimiento de cosecha por hectarea dedicandose a la agricultura cientifica y tecnica conforme a las caracteristicas zonales, en pleno acato a las instrucciones del Dirigente Kim Jong Il dadas en el terreno.

articles.title: Tifon-9 acarreara muchas lluvias a Corea
articles.content:
Tifon-9 acarreara muchas lluvias a Corea
						

					Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ACNC) -- Segun el pronostico del tiempo del Instituto Central Meteorologico, se preve que caeran durante los dias 8 y 9 muchas lluvias en algunas localidades de Corea.
					
					Al respecto, citado por la reportera de la ACNC, el subdirector del mencionado instituto, Choe Kwang Guk (de 48 anos de edad), senalo:
					
					El tifon-9 Muifa, que se encuentra en el mar al sur de Okinawa de Japon en las 15:00 de dia 5, se movera hacia la direccion noroeste y llegara a eso de las 09:00 del dia 7 al mar frente a la provincia de Zhejiang de China.
					
					Tras alcanzarse a eso de las 09:00 del dia 9 en la parte nortena de la bahia de Palhae atravesando el dia 8 la peninsula de Sandong de China, el tifon se debilitara en la depresion atmosferica de la zona templada y se movera hacia la direccion noreste, con la cual nuestro pais se sometera bajo su influencia.
					
					El tifon causara en las areas de la costa occidental los fuertes vientos de mas de 10m/s, 40-70mm de lluvias en varias localidades y mas de 100mm de lluvias en algunas zonas.
					
					Ademas, durante los dias 8 y 10 se preven en el Mar Oeste de Corea el viento sureste de 13-18 m/s y las olas de 3-5 metros de altura.
